content.description: On the left hand side of the crag there is an obvious overhang with big blocky features.  Uluwatu goes out the overhang and ends with a real nice tough sloper topout
content.location: Right hand side of the cliff out a small overhang.

content.description: Start on a massive jug on the  right side of the wall and go up interesting jugs.  Drop off from the top jug.
content.location: Right side of the Bukit Wall.

content.description: 4' right of the Barong start on the massive jug and make a big lock off to a big pinch.  Climb out the overhanging wave and connect with the Barong mantel finish.

Good rock and big holds gets you off the ground quick and moving out the left side of the overhanging wall.  Then when you are about 12' you are faced with an interesting mantel high off the ground.  Definitely one of the best problems for the grade in the Park.
content.location: Left side of the Bukit Wall.

content.description: Start off a huge eyebrow pocket and go up jugs trending left into the Tedak Bagus finish.  Good warm up.
content.location: Right most climb on the Bukit.

content.description: This boulder crag is located in the North East Corner of the Park.  Walk up the Buck Road from the Main Loop road and take the first road on the left after about a 20 minute hike.  The Bukit Crag (Bukit...meaning "Hill" in Indonesian) is on the right after 2 minutes of walking down this road.  If you reach the marsh area you have gone to far.  The Bukit is an interesting formation in that it is steep, featured, and has good rock quality.  Of note there are a couple projects that involve huge dyno moves, so if you like to jump and slam gneiss holds or slopers this is the spot.
